intro: Manihot elegans, commonly known as arrowleaf balsam, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Botanically, it belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other flowering plants with similar structural features.
